dialog: (TAKE ME OUT TO THE BALL GAME PLAYlNG ON VlDEO GAME) Hi, honey.
Mom, can't you tell him l'm sick?
Hey, how is the sickie? Huh?
l think l'll leave you two pals alone.
l brought you a special present.
When l was your age, television was called books.
And this is a special book.
lt was the book my father used to read to me when l was sick, and l used to read it to your father.
And today, l'm gonna read it to you.
Has it got any sports in it?
Fencing, fighting, torture, revenge, giants, monsters, chases, escapes, true love, miracles.
Your vote of confidence is overwhelming.
"Buttercup was raised on a small farm in the country of Florin.
"Her favorite pastimes were riding her horse "and tormenting the farm boy that worked there.
"His name was Westley, but she never called him that." Isn't that a wonderful beginning?
"Nothing gave Buttercup as much pleasure as ordering Westley around." Farm Boy, polish my horse's saddle.
l want to see my face shining in it by morning.
GRANDFATHER: "'As you wish' was all he ever said to her." Farm Boy, fill these with water.

"That day, she was amazed to discover "that when he was saying, 'As you wish,' "what he meant was, 'I love you.' "And even more amazing was the day she realized she truly loved him back." Farm Boy, fetch me that pitcher.
Are you trying to trick me?
"Westley had no money for marriage, "so he packed his few belongings and left the farm "to seek his fortune across the sea.
"It was a very emotional time for Buttercup." GRANDSON: I don't believe this.
l fear l'll never see you again.
But what if something happens to you?
l will always come for you.
But how can you be sure?
Do you think this happens every day?
"His ship was attacked by the Dread Pirate Roberts, "who never left captives alive.
"When Buttercup got the news that Westley was murdered..." GRANDSON: Murdered by pirates is good.
"...she went into her room and shut the door.
"And for days, she neither slept nor ate." l will never love again.

"Five years later, the main square of Florin City was filled as never before "to hear the announcement of the great Prince Humperdinck's bridetobe." My people, a month from now, our country will have its 500th anniversary.
On that sundown, l shall marry a lady who was once a commoner like yourselves.
But perhaps you will not find her common now.
Would you like to meet her?
"Although the law of the land gave Humperdinck the right "to choose his bride, "she did not love him.
"Despite Humperdinck's reassurance that she would grow to love him, "the only joy she found was in her daily ride." MAN: A word, my lady?
We are but poor, lost circus performers.
There is nothing nearby, not for miles.
Then there will be no one to hear you scream.
lt is fabric from the uniform of an army officer of Guilder.
Go! Once the horse reaches the castle, the fabric will make the prince suspect the Guilderians have abducted his love.
When he finds her body dead on the Guilder frontier, his suspicions will be totally confirmed.
You never said anything about killing anyone.
l've hired you to help me start a war.
lt's a prestigious line of work with a long and glorious tradition.
l just don't think it's right killing an innocent girl.
Am l going mad or did the word "think" escape your lips?
You were not hired for your brains, you hippopotamic landmass!
What happens to her is not truly your concern.
When l found you, you were so slobbering drunk you couldn't buy brandy!
Do you want me to send you back to where you were?
l think he like to scream at us.
He's really very short on charm.
You have a great gift for rhyme.
lNlGO: Fezzik, are there rocks ahead?
FEZZlK: lf there are, we'll all be dead.
VlZZlNl: No more rhymes now, l mean it!
We'll reach the cliffs by dawn.
Are you sure nobody's follow us?
Despite what you think, you will be caught.
And when you are, the Prince will see you all hanged.
Of all the necks on this boat, Highness, the one you should be worrying about is your own.
You are sure nobody's follow us?
As l told you, it would be absolutely, totally and in all other ways inconceivable.
No one in Guilder knows what we've done and no one in Florin could have gotten here so fast.
Out of curiosity, why do you ask?
Suddenly, l just happen to look behind us and something is there.
Probably some local fisherman out for a pleasure cruise at night through eelinfested waters.
What? Go in ! Get after her!
VlZZlNl: Do you know what that sound is, Highness?
lf you don't believe me, just wait.
They always grow louder when they're about to feed on human flesh !
lf you swim back now, l promise no harm will come to you.
l doubt you'll get such an offer from the eels.
She doesn't get eaten by the eels at this time.
l'm explaining to you because you look nervous.
Maybe l was a little bit concerned, but that's not the same thing.
Because we can stop now if you want.
No, you could read a little bit more if you want.
"Do you know what that sound is, Highness?
"Those are the shrieking eels." We're past that, Grandpa.
Let's see, she was in the water.
The eel was coming after her.
The eel started to charge her, and then...
l suppose you think you're brave, don't you?
He's right on top of us!
l wonder if he is using the same wind we are using.
Whoever he is, he's too late. See?
We're safe. Only Fezzik is strong enough to go up our way.
He'll have to sail around for hours till he finds a harbor.
He's climbing the rope and he's gaining on us.
FEZZlK: l thought l was going faster.
You were supposed to be this colossus.
You were this great legendary thing.
Well, l'm carrying three people, and he got only himself.
l'm just going to have to find myself a new giant, that's all.
Did l make it clear that your job is at stake?
l do not think it means what you think it means.
Whoever he is, he's obviously seen us with the Princess and must, therefore, die.
We'll head straight for the Guilder frontier.
l'm going to duel him lefthanded.
You know what a hurry we're in !
lt's the only way l can be satisfied.
lf l use my right, over too quickly.
People in masks cannot be trusted.
Look, l don't mean to be rude, but this is not as easy as it looks, so l'd appreciate it if you wouldn't distract me.
l don't suppose you could speed things up?
lf you're in such a hurry, you could lower a rope or a tree branch, or find something useful to do.
l've got some rope up here.
But l do not think you would accept my help, since l am only waiting around to kill you.
That does put a damper on our relationship.
But l promise l will not kill you until you reach the top.
That's very comforting, but l'm afraid you'll just have to wait.
l could give you my word as a Spaniard.
ls there any way you'll trust me?
l swear on the soul of my father, Domingo Montoya, you will reach the top alive.
l do not mean to pry, but you don't by any chance happen to have six fingers on your right hand?
Do you always begin conversations this way?
My father was slaughtered by a sixfingered man.
He was a great sword maker, my father.
When the sixfingered man appeared and requested a special sword, my father took the job.
He slaved a year before he was done.
The sixfingered man returned and demanded it, but at onetenth his promised price.
Without a word, the sixfingered man slashed him through the heart.
So, naturally, l challenged his murderer to a duel.
The sixfingered man leave me alive.
When l was strong enough, l dedicated my life to the study of fencing.
So, the next time we meet, l will not fail.
l will go up to the sixfingered man and say, "Hello. My name is lnigo Montoya.
Prepare to die." You've done nothing but study swordplay?
More pursue it than study, lately.
You see, l cannot find him.
l just work for Vizzini to pay the bills.
There's not a lot of money in revenge.
Well, l certainly hope you find him someday.
Whether l am or not, you've been more than fair.
You are using Bonetti's defense against me, huh?
l thought it fitting, considering the rocky terrain.
Naturally, you must expect me to attack with Capo Ferro.
Naturally. But l find that Thibault cancels out Capo Ferro, don't you?
Unless the enemy has studied his Agrippa.
l've worked hard to become so.
l admit that you are better than l am.
Because l know something you don't know.
l ought to be, after 20 years.
(GRUNTlNG) There's something l ought to tell you.
l would as soon destroy a stainedglass window as an artist like yourself.
However, since l can't have you following me, either. . .
Please understand, l hold you in the highest respect.
Pick up one of those rocks.
ln a few minutes, the man in black will come running around the bend.
The minute his head is in view, hit it with the rock!
We face each other as God intended.
You mean, you'll put down your rock and l'll put down my sword, and we'll try and kill each other like civilized people?
Frankly, l think the odds are slightly in your favor at handfighting.
lt's not my fault for being the biggest and the strongest.
Look, are you just fiddling around with me, or what?
l just want you to feel you're doing well.
l hate for people to die embarrassed.
Why are you wearing a mask?
Were you burned by acid or something like that?
No, it's just that they're terribly comfortable.
l think everyone will be wearing them in the future.
(GRUNTlNG) l just figured why you give me so much trouble.
Well, l haven't fought just one person for so long.
l've been specializing in groups, battling gangs for local charities, that kind of thing.
Why should that make such a. . .difference?
Well, you see, you use different moves when you're fighting half a dozen people than when you only have to be worried about one.
l do not envy you the headache you will have when you awake.
But in the meantime, rest well and dream of large women.
Who won? How did it end?
The loser ran off alone, but the winner followed those footprints toward Guilder.
Clearly, this was all planned by warriors of Guilder.
We must all be ready for whatever lies ahead.
l always think everything could be a trap, which is why l'm still alive.
So, it is down to you and it is down to me.
lf you wish her dead, by all means, keep moving forward.
You're trying to kidnap what l've rightfully stolen.
Perhaps an arrangement can be reached?
There will be no arrangement, and you're killing her.
Well, if there can be no arrangement, then we are at an impasse.
l'm afraid so. l can't compete with you physically, and you're no match for my brains.
Let me put it this way.
Have you ever heard of Plato, Aristotle, Socrates?
ln that case, l challenge you to a battle of wits.
lnhale this, but do not touch.
What you do not smell is called iocane powder.
lt is odorless, tasteless, dissolves instantly in liquid, and is among the more deadly poisons known to man.
The battle of wits has begun.
lt ends when you decide, and we both drink and find out who is right and who is dead.
All l have to do is divine from what l know of you.
Are you the sort of man who would put the poison into his own goblet or his enemy's?
Now, a clever man would put the poison into his own goblet because he would know that only a great fool would reach for what he was given.
l'm not a great fool, so l can clearly not choose the wine in front of you.
But you must have known l was not a great fool.
You would've counted on it, so l can clearly not choose the wine in front of me.

Because iocane comes from Australia, as everyone knows, and Australia is entirely peopled with criminals, and criminals are used to having people not trust them, as you are not trusted by me, so l can clearly not choose the wine in front of you.
Truly, you have a dizzying intellect.
And you must have suspected l would have known the powder's origin, so l can clearly not choose the wine in front of me.
You'd like to think that, wouldn't you?

You've beaten my giant, which means you're exceptionally strong, so you could've put the poison in your own goblet, trusting on your strength to save you, so l can clearly not choose the wine in front of you.

But you've also bested my Spaniard, which means you must've studied, and in studying, you must have learned that man is mortal, so you would've put the poison as far from yourself as possible, so l can clearly not choose the wine in front of me.
You're trying to trick me into giving away something.
l know where the poison is.
What in the world can that be?
l could've sworn l saw something.
l'll tell you in a minute.
First, let's drink, me from my glass and you from yours.
You only think l guessed wrong.
l switched glasses while your back was turned !
(LAUGHlNG) You fool, you fell victim to one of the classic blunders.
The most famous is never get involved in a land war in Asia, but only slightly less well known is this.
Never go in against a Sicilian when death is on the line!
l'm no one to be trifled with.
That is all you ever need know.
To think, all that time it was your cup that was poisoned.
l spent the last few years building up an immunity to iocane powder.
There will be great suffering in Guilder if she dies.
lf you'll release me, whatever you ask for ransom, you'll get it, l promise you.
And what is that worth, the promise of a woman?
l was giving you a chance.
lt does not matter where you take me.
There's no greater hunter than Prince Humperdinck.
He can track a falcon on a cloudy day.
You think your dearest love will save you?
l never said he was my dearest love, and yes, he will save me.
You admit to me you do not love your fiancÃ©?
He knows l do not love him.
Are not capable of love, is what you mean.
l have loved more deeply than a killer like yourself could ever dream.
The next time, my hand flies on its own, for where l come from, there are penalties when a woman lies.
locane. l'd bet my life on it.
And there are the Princess's footprints.
She is alive, or was, an hour ago.
lf she is otherwise when l find her, l shall be very put out.
What can l do for you?
You can die slowly, cut into a thousand pieces.
Why loose your venom on me?
l kill a lot of people.
Who was this love of yours?
With eyes like the sea after a storm.
On the high seas your ship attacked, and the Dread Pirate Roberts never takes prisoners.
l can't afford to make exceptions.
l mean, once word leaks out that a pirate has gone soft, people begin to disobey you, and then it's nothing but work, work, work all the time.
Anyone who says differently is selling something.
l remember this farm boy of yours, l think.
Does it bother you to hear?
Nothing you can say will upset me.
He simply said, "Please. Please, l need to live." lt was the "please" that caught my memory.
l asked him what was so important for him.
And then he spoke of a girl of surpassing beauty and faithfulness.
l can only assume he meant you.
You should bless me for destroying him before he found out what you really are.
When you found out he was gone, did you get engaged to your prince that same hour, or did you wait a whole week out of respect for the dead?
You can die, too, for all l care!
He must have seen us closing in.
Which might account for his panicking into error.
Unless l am wrong, and l am never wrong, they are headed dead into the Fire Swamp.
lf you want, l can fly.
l told you l would always come for you.
Why didn't you wait for me?
All it can do is delay it for a while.
There will never be a need.
Do we have to hear the kissing part?
Someday, you may not mind so much.
Skip on to the Fire Swamp.
So, now, where were we here?
GRANDFATHER: "Westley and Buttercup raced along the ravine floor." Ha! Your pig fiancÃ© is too late.
A few more steps and we'll be safe in the Fire Swamp.
You're only saying that because no one ever has.
l'm not saying l'd like to build a summer home here, but the trees are actually quite lovely.
Well, now, that was an adventure.
Well, one thing l will say, the Fire Swamp certainly does keep you on your toes.
This will all soon be but a happy memory, because Roberts' ship, Revenge, is anchored at the far end, and l, as you know, am Roberts.
But how is that possible, since he's been marauding 20 years and you only left me five years ago?
l, myself, am often surprised at life's little quirks.
See, what l told you before about saying "please" was true.
lt intrigued Roberts, as did my description of your beauty.
You can try it for tonight.
"l'll most likely kill you in the morning." Three years, he said that.
l'll most likely kill you in the morning." lt was a fine time for me.
l was learning to fence, to fight, anything anyone would teach me.
And Roberts and l eventually became friends.
Roberts had grown so rich he wanted to retire, so he took me to his cabin and told me a secret.
"l am not the Dread Pirate Roberts," he said.
"l inherited the ship from the previous Dread Pirate Roberts, "just as you will inherit it from me.
"The man l inherited it from was not the real Dread Pirate Roberts either.
The real Roberts has been retired 1 5 years "and living like a king in Patagonia." Thank you.
Then he explained the name was the important thing for inspiring the necessary fear.
You see, no one would surrender to the Dread Pirate Westley.
So, we sailed ashore, took on an entirely new crew, and he stayed aboard for a while, as first mate, all the time calling me Roberts.
Once the crew believed, he left the ship, and l have been Roberts ever since.
Except, now that we're together, l shall retire and hand the name over to someone else.
We may as well die here.
l mean, what are the three terrors of the Fire Swamp?
There's a popping sound preceding each.
Two, the lightning sand, but you were clever enough to discover what that looks like, so in the future, we can avoid that, too.
Westley, what about the R.O. U.S.s?
You mean, you wish to surrender to me?
l give you full marks for bravery.
But how will you capture us?
We know the secrets of the Fire Swamp.
We can live there quite happily for some time, so whenever you feel like dying, feel free to visit.
HUMPERDlNCK: l tell you once again, surrender!
Will you promise not to hurt him?
lf we surrender, and l return with you, will you promise not to hurt this man?
May l live a thousand years and never hunt again.
He is a sailor on the pirate ship Revenge.
Promise to return him to his ship.
l swear it will be done.
Once we are out of sight, take him back to Florin and throw him in the Pit of Despair.
l swear it will be done.
l thought you were dead once, and it almost destroyed me.
l could not bear it if you died again, not when l could save you.
We must get you to your ship.
You have six fingers on your right hand.
(NORMALLY) Don't even think about trying to escape.
The chains are far too thick.
And don't dream of being rescued either.
The only way in is secret.
Only the Prince, the Count and l know how to get in and out.
Then l'm here till l die?
The Prince and the Count always insist on everyone being healthy before they're broken.
She's been like that ever since the Fire Swamp.
lt's my father's failing health that's upsetting her.
GRANDFATHER: "The King died that very night, "and before the following dawn, "Buttercup and Humperdinck were married.
"And at noon, she met her subjects again, this time as their queen." My father's final words were. . .
GRANDSON: Hold it. Hold it, Grandpa.
After all that Westley did for her, if she didn't marry him, it wouldn't be fair.
Well, who says life is fair?
l'm telling you, you're messing up the story.
Do you want me to go on with this?
"At noon, she met her subjects again, this time as their queen." My father's final words were, "Love her as l loved her, "and there will be joy." l present to you your queen, Queen Buttercup.
Because you had love in your hands and you gave it up!
But they would've killed Westley if l hadn't done it.
Your true love lives, and you marry another!
True love saved her in the Fire Swamp and she treated it like garbage.
And that's what she is, the queen of refuse!
So bow down to her if you want, bow to her.
Bow to the queen of slime, the queen of filth, the queen of putrescence!
GRANDFATHER: "It was 1 0 days till the wedding.
"The King still lived, but Buttercup's nightmares were growing steadily worse." GRANDSON: See?
Didn't I tell you she'd never marry that rotten Humperdinck?
l know now, l always will.
lf you tell me l must marry you in 1 0 days, please believe l will be dead by morning.
l could never cause you grief.
You, uh, returned this Westley to his ship?
Then we will simply alert him.
Beloved, are you certain he still wants you?
After all, it was you who did the leaving in the Fire Swamp.
Not to mention that, uh, pirates are not known to be men of their words.
My Westley will always come for me.
You write four copies of a letter.
l'll send my four fastest ships, one in each direction.
The Dread Pirate Roberts is always close to Florin this time of year.
We'll run up the white flag and deliver your message.
lf Westley wants you, bless you both.
lf not, please consider me as an alternative to suicide.
Your princess is really quite a winning creature.
A trifle simple, perhaps, but her appeal is undeniable.
l know. The people are quite taken with her.
lt's odd, but when l hired Vizzini to have her murdered on our engagement day, l thought that was clever.
But it's going to be so much more moving when l strangle her on our wedding night.
Once Guilder is blamed, the nation will be truly outraged.
They'll demand we go to war.
Now, where is that secret knot?
Are you coming down into the pit?
l'm starting him on the machine tonight.
Tyrone, you know how much l love watching you work.
But l've got my country's my wedding to arrange, my wife to murder, and Guilder to frame for it.
lf you haven't got your health, you haven't got anything.
Took me half a lifetime to invent it.
l'm sure you've discovered my deep and abiding interest in pain.
At present, l'm writing the definitive work on the subject.
So, l want you to be totally honest with me on how the machine makes you feel.
This being our first try, l'll use the lowest setting.
As you know, the concept of the suction pump is centuries old.
Really, that's all this is, except that instead of sucking water, l'm sucking life.
l've just sucked one year of your life away.
l might one day go as high as five, but l really don't know what that would do to you.
So, let's just start with what we have.
What did this do to you?
And remember, this is for posterity, so be honest.
As Chief Enforcer of all Florin, l trust you with this secret.
Killers from Guilder are infiltrating the Thieves' Forest and plan to murder my bride on our wedding night.
My spy network has heard no such news.
On the day of the wedding, l want the Thieves' Forest emptied, and every inhabitant arrested.
(SlGHlNG) Many of the thieves will resist.
My regular enforcers will be inadequate.
l want the Thieves' Forest emptied before l wed.
GRANDFATHER: "The day of the wedding arrived.
"The Brute Squad had their hands full carrying out Humperdinck's orders." ls everybody out?
There's a Spaniard giving us some trouble.
Well, you give him some trouble.
l am waiting for you, Vizzini.
You told me to go back to the beginning, so l have.
This is where l am and this is where l'll stay.
Keep your "Ho, there." But the Prince gave orders.
When a job went wrong, you went back to the beginning.
Well, this is where we got the job, so it's the beginning.
And l am staying till Vizzini comes.
You don't smell so good either.
"And as Fezzik nursed his inebriated friend back to health, "he told Inigo of Vizzini's death "and the existence of Count Rugen, "the sixfingered man.
"Considering Inigo's lifelong search, "he handled the news surprisingly well.
"Fezzik took great care in reviving Inigo." That's enough !
Where is this Rugen now, so l may kill him?
He's with the Prince in the castle.
But the castle gate is guarded by 30 men.
At my best, l could never defeat that many.
l have no gift for strategy.
l need the man in black.
Look. He bested you with strength, your greatness.
And a man who can do that can plan my castle onslaught any day.
Find the man in black, obviously.
But you don't know where he is.
After 20 years, at last my father's soul will be at peace.
YELLlN: The Thieves' Forest is emptied.
Thirty men guard the castle gate.
The gate has but one key.
Tomorrow morning, your men will escort us to Florin Channel, where every ship in my armada waits to accompany us on our honeymoon.
Every ship but your four fastest, you mean.
Every ship but the four you sent.
Westley will come for me anyway.
Yes, l am a silly girl, for not having seen sooner that you are nothing but a coward with a heart full of fear.
l would not say such things if l were you.
Why not? You can't hurt me.
Westley and l are joined by the bonds of love.
And you cannot track that, not with a thousand bloodhounds.
And you cannot break it, not with a thousand swords.
And when l say you're a coward, that is only because you are the slimiest weakling ever to crawl the earth !
l would not say such things if l were you !
You truly love each other, and so you might have been truly happy.
Not one couple in a century has that chance, no matter what the storybooks say.
And so, l think no man in a century will suffer as greatly as you will.
That is the sound of ultimate suffering.
My heart made that sound when Rugen slaughtered my father.
The man in black makes it now.
His true love is marrying another tonight, so who else has the cause for ultimate suffering?
Excuse me. Pardon me, it's important.
lNlGO: Where is the man in black?
You get there from this grove, yes?
l didn't meant to jog him so hard.
Father, l have failed you for 20 years.
Somewhere close by is a man who can help us.
l need you to guide my sword.
l mean, he didn't mean "dead." Westley's only faking, right?
You want me to read this or not?
Jesus, Grandpa, what did you read me this thing for?
You know, you've been very sick and you're taking this story very seriously.
l think we ought to stop now.
The Montoyas have never taken defeat easily.
l just hope it's enough to buy a miracle, that's all.
Are you the Miracle Max who worked for the King all those years?
The King's stinking son fired me, and thank you so much for bringing up such a painful subject.
While you're at it, why don't you give me a nice paper cut and pour lemon juice on it?
Beat it, or l'll call the Brute Squad.
And besides, why would you want someone the King's stinking son fired?
l might kill whoever you wanted me to miracle.
He is, huh? l'll take a look.
You rush a miracle man, you get rotten miracles.
l never worked for so little, except once, and that was a very noble cause.
His children are on the brink of starvation.
l need him to help avenge my father, murdered these 20 years.
He probably owes you money, huh?
Look who knows so much, huh.
Well, it just so happens that your friend here is only mostly dead.
There's a big difference between mostly dead and all dead.
Now, mostly dead is slightly alive.
Well, with all dead, there's usually only one thing that you can do.
Go through his clothes and look for loose change.
What you got here that's worth living for?
You could not ask for a more noble cause than that.
Sonny, true love is the greatest thing in the world, except for a nice M. L.T.
A mutton, lettuce and tomato sandwich when the mutton is nice and lean and the tomato is ripe.
They're so perky. l love that.
But that's not what he said.
He distinctly said, "To blave." And as we all know, "to blave" means "to bluff." Huh?
So you're probably playing cards and he cheated. . .
l'm not a witch, l'm your wife!
But after what you just said, l'm not even sure l want to be that anymore.
You never had it so good.
He's afraid. Ever since Prince Humperdinck fired him, his confidence is shattered.
You promised me that you'd never say that name!
True love lies expiring, and you don't have the decency to say why you won't help.
lNlGO: This is Buttercup's true love.
lf you heal him, he will stop Humperdinck's wedding.
l make him better, Humperdinck suffers?
The chocolate coating makes it go down easier.
But you have to wait And you shouldn't go in swimming after for at least. . .
We've got him. Help me here.
The wedding's in half an hour.
We must strike in the hustle and the bustle beforehand.
How long do we have to wait before if we know if the miracle works?
Your guess is as good as mine.
l'll beat you at your part.
You've been mostly dead all day.
We had Miracle Max make a pill to bring you back.
Why am l on this wall?
Buttercup is marrying Humperdinck in a little less than half an hour, so all we have to do is get in, break up the wedding, steal the princess, make our escape.
That doesn't leave much time for dillydallying.
l've always been a quick healer.
There is but one working castle gate.
